text: so who's bumming who in Syria well the
Syrian President Bashar al-assad is
facing an armed uprising in his own
country he's been trying to crush it
with help from his friends Iran Russia
and Hezbollah from Lebanon on the other
side the US Turkey and the Gulf Arabs
and most of the Western world want a set
to go they had been arming and training
many of the rebels trying to unseat him
but the trouble is one of the main
insurgent groups is the so-called
Islamic state and everyone hates is
including the other rebels so now
everyone's all on the same side against
is right well not quite Russia says its
bombing is but it's also bomb some of
the other rebel groups fighting Assad
some of those groups are being funded by
Gulf countries like Saudi Arabia and
other [ __ ] rivals of Iran meanwhile the
Turks say they want asset gone but
they're not bombing him yet
instead they're bombing is a bit but
also bombing the Kurds a lot more the
Kurds have enemies in asset is and
Turkey but the same Kurds are backed by
the US were allies with their enemies
Turkey so to sum up America's friends
are fighting each other
while also fighting their enemy who's a
bigger enemy than their other enemy got
it
